connector.description: Poll for changes in Google Sheets.

camel.source.endpoint.applicationName.name: camel.source.endpoint.applicationName
camel.source.endpoint.applicationName.description: Google sheets application name. Example would be camel-google-sheets/1.0

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.clientId.name: camel.source.endpoint.clientId
camel.source.endpoint.clientId.description: Client ID of the sheets application

camel.source.endpoint.includeGridData.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeGridData
camel.source.endpoint.includeGridData.description: True if grid data should be returned.

camel.source.endpoint.majorDimension.name: camel.source.endpoint.majorDimension
camel.source.endpoint.majorDimension.description: Specifies the major dimension that results should use.. One of: [ROWS] [COLUMNS] [DIMENSION_UNSPECIFIED]

camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxResults
camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.description: Specify the maximum number of returned results. This will limit the number of rows in a returned value range data set or the number of returned value ranges in a batch request.

camel.source.endpoint.range.name: camel.source.endpoint.range
camel.source.endpoint.range.description: Specifies the range of rows and columns in a sheet to get data from.

camel.source.endpoint.scopes.name: camel.source.endpoint.scopes
camel.source.endpoint.scopes.description: Specifies the level of permissions you want a sheets application to have to a user account. See https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/googlescopes for more info.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.splitResults.name: camel.source.endpoint.splitResults
camel.source.endpoint.splitResults.description: True if value range result should be split into rows or columns to process each of them individually. When true each row or column is represented with a separate exchange in batch processing. Otherwise value range object is used as exchange junk size.

camel.source.endpoint.spreadsheetId.name: camel.source.endpoint.spreadsheetId
camel.source.endpoint.spreadsheetId.description: Specifies the spreadsheet identifier that is used to identify the target to obtain.

camel.source.endpoint.valueRenderOption.name: camel.source.endpoint.valueRenderOption
camel.source.endpoint.valueRenderOption.description: Determines how values should be rendered in the output. One of: [FORMATTED_VALUE] [UNFORMATTED_VALUE] [FORMULA]

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessToken
camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

camel.source.endpoint.clientSecret.name: camel.source.endpoint.clientSecret
camel.source.endpoint.clientSecret.description: Client secret of the sheets application

camel.source.endpoint.refreshToken.name: camel.source.endpoint.refreshToken
camel.source.endpoint.refreshToken.description: OAuth 2 refresh token. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.app.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.applicationName
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.app.description: Google sheets application name. Example would be camel-google-sheets/1.0

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.bri.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.bri.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.cli.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.clientId
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.cli.description: Client ID of the sheets application

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.inc.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.includeGridData
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.inc.description: True if grid data should be returned.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.maj.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.majorDimension
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.maj.description: Specifies the major dimension that results should use.. One of: [ROWS] [COLUMNS] [DIMENSION_UNSPECIFIED]

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.max.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.maxResults
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.max.description: Specify the maximum number of returned results. This will limit the number of rows in a returned value range data set or the number of returned value ranges in a batch request.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.ran.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.range
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.ran.description: Specifies the range of rows and columns in a sheet to get data from.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.sco.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.scopes
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.sco.description: Specifies the level of permissions you want a sheets application to have to a user account. See https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/googlescopes for more info.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.spl.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.splitResults
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.spl.description: True if value range result should be split into rows or columns to process each of them individually. When true each row or column is represented with a separate exchange in batch processing. Otherwise value range object is used as exchange junk size.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.spr.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.spreadsheetId
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.spr.description: Specifies the spreadsheet identifier that is used to identify the target to obtain.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.val.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.valueRenderOption
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.val.description: Determines how values should be rendered in the output. One of: [FORMATTED_VALUE] [UNFORMATTED_VALUE] [FORMULA]

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.aut.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.aut.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.cli.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.clientFactory
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.cli.description: To use the GoogleSheetsClientFactory as factory for creating the client. Will by default use BatchGoogleSheetsClientFactory

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.acc.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.accessToken
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.acc.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.cli.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.clientSecret
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.cli.description: Client secret of the sheets application

camel.component.google-sheets-stream.ref.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.refreshToken
camel.component.google-sheets-stream.ref.description: OAuth 2 refresh token. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.
